moments.quote:
you got to put almost in there Tracy you
can't get along with everybody
especially if they don't want to get
along with you that's a PR you can't
keep if you have a title like get along
with
everybody the book basically focuses on
changing others by changing yourself
most common question Tracy that I get as
a shrink is
this will you tell me how to change
somebody
else I tell them I have a hard enough
time changing you so the book really
focuses on getting along with people
through taking a good hard look at
yourself and saying okay what can I do
moments.why_it_hits: Flips the fantasy of changing other people into a hard truth about changing yourself, with a playful jab that lands.

persona_captions.ex_protestant: I stopped trying to ‘fix’ everyone else.
persona_captions.catholic: Grace starts with your own conversion.

moments.quote:
do watch your language in the very first
chapter I talk about some words that are
terribly
overused one of them is narcissist oh
she's a narcissist oh my spouse is a
narcissist my mother-in-law is a
narcissist my friend is a narcissist
narcissism is a serious personality
disorder we fling that word around and
what it does Tracy it makes it sound
like these people are not reachable the
second thing is you got to give up the
demand and it is a demand Tracy that
people be different than they are I'll
moments.why_it_hits: Calls out the internet’s favorite insult and exposes how labeling people ‘narcissist’ becomes an excuse to write them off.

persona_captions.historian: We cheapened a clinical word into a slur.
persona_captions.ex_protestant: I used ‘narcissist’ to avoid loving people.
persona_captions.meme_catholic: Not everyone you dislike is a narcissist.
persona_captions.old_world_catholic: Name sins, not souls as hopeless.

moments.quote:
more about that and what you think that
looks like easygoing means and I say
this for us Christians we should be
among the most easygo of people we
should my father-in-law he he wants the
front seat every time we go somewhere I
don't like the back seat okay Dad you
can have the front seat my wife wants to
go watch some movie about orphan puppies
that are saved by a grizzly bear I want
to go watch Terminator
moments.why_it_hits: Challenges Christians to prove their faith in tiny daily sacrifices, using a funny, ultra-relatable example.

persona_captions.ex_protestant: My faith got real in tiny choices.
persona_captions.meme_catholic: Be Catholic: let them pick the movie.
persona_captions.old_world_catholic: Yield the seat; gain the virtue.
persona_captions.catholic: Real Christians are easy to live with.
